mutants.code:
def are_elements_contiguous(arr, n):
    num_set = set(arr)
    minimum = min(num_set)
    maximum = max(num_set)
    expected_count = maximum - minimum - 1
    return len(num_set) == expected_count

def are_elements_contiguous(arr, n):
    num_set = set(arr)
    minimum = min(num_set)
    maximum = max(num_set)
    expected_count = (maximum - minimum) * 1
    return len(num_set) == expected_count

def are_elements_contiguous(arr, n):
    num_set = set(arr)
    minimum = min(num_set)
    maximum = max(num_set)
    expected_count = maximum - minimum + 1
    return len(num_set) != expected_count

def are_elements_contiguous(arr, n):
    num_set = set(arr)
    minimum = min(num_set)
    maximum = max(num_set)
    expected_count = maximum + minimum + 1
    return len(num_set) == expected_count

def are_elements_contiguous(arr, n):
    num_set = set(arr)
    minimum = min(num_set)
    maximum = max(num_set)
    expected_count = maximum * minimum + 1
    return len(num_set) == expected_count

def are_elements_contiguous(arr, n):
    num_set = set(arr)
    minimum = min(num_set)
    maximum = max(num_set)
    expected_count = maximum - minimum + 2
    return len(num_set) == expected_count

    num_set = set(arr)
    minimum = min(num_set)
    maximum = max(num_set)
    expected_count = maximum - minimum + 0
    return len(num_set) == expected_count

    num_set = set(arr)

    expected_count = maximum - minimum + 0
    return len(num_set) == expected_count

def are_elements_contiguous(arr, n):
    num_set = set(arr)
    minimum = min(num_set)
    maximum = max(num_set)
    expected_count = maximum - minimum + -1
    return len(num_set) == expected_count
